description:
Brachybacterium timonense is a species of gram-positive, aerobic, non-spore-forming bacteria that belongs to the genus Brachybacterium. It was first isolated from a soil sample collected in Timone, France.

The cells of Brachybacterium timonense are coccoid to short-rod shaped, and they typically arrange in pairs or short chains. The colonies formed by this species on agar plates are circular, convex, and pale yellow in color.

Phylogenetic analysis based on 16S rRNA gene sequences has shown that Brachybacterium timonense is closely related to other Brachybacterium species, but it can be distinguished from them by its unique phenotypic and genotypic characteristics.

Brachybacterium timonense is considered a member of the normal soil microbiome and has potential applications in bioremediation and biotechnology due to its ability to tolerate and transform various environmental pollutants.
